item.title: IGN Presents | The Callisto Protocol: Helix Station
item.description:
Subscribe to the horror series set in the universe of “The Callisto Protocol,” the hotly anticipated game from Striking Distance Studios.  

Helix Station was once the jewel of the Jovian system, but it’s been a decaying ghost ship ever since its Carpenter drive went supercritical. When a dangerous escaped criminal seeks refuge there, officers of the Black Iron Prison force a pair of veteran skip tracers to help recover him. But once on Helix, they discover murderous alien life forms, as well as unspeakable horrors from their past.

Starring Gwendoline Christie and Michael Ironside. IGN is publishing and distributing Helix Station in partnership with 
Striking Distance Studios, creator of the game The Callisto Protocol. The first two episodes of The Callisto Protocol: Helix Station 
are available now, with new episodes dropping every Thursday. You can find it wherever you get your podcasts.

Listen & Subscribe here!
item.author: dan_parkhurst@ign.com (Gwendoline Christie, Michael Ironside, Striking Distance Studios)

item.itunes:summary: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast ever created! You'd think others would have caught on by now but nope! item.title: Game Scoop! 692: Our Most Anticipated 2023 Games
item.description:
Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Sam Claiborn, Justin Davis,  and Mark Medina -- are sharing their most-anticipated games of 2023. That means The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, Resident Evil 4, Redfall, and more. They'll also check in with the Nintendo Seal of Quantity. Daemon has been playing Return to Monkey Island and Mark has been playing Mario +And, Rabbids: Sparks of Hope.  of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

item.title: Game Scoop! 690: Cyberpunk's Phantom Premise
item.description:
Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Sam Claiborn, John Davison,  and Stella Chung -- are discussing Cyberpunk 2077: Phantom Liberty, the September 2006 issue of Nintendo Power, ragdoll physics, House of the Dragon, and more. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

 

Follow Daemon on Twitter @DaemZero

item.title: Game Scoop! 688: Our Favorite Games of Gamescom 2022
item.description:
Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! Daemon is away in Germany covering gamescom so your Omega Cops this week are Samuel Claiborn, Justin Davis, Kat Bailey, and Colin Stevens. This week we discuss our pics for collects Gamescom reveals, like Dead Island 2, Where Winds Meet, Lies of P, and Killer Klowns from Outer Space. We also talk about 25 years of poorly aged FPS action as Goldeneye turns a quarter-of-a-century old.

 

00:00:00 Intro

00:00:50 Gamescom 2022

00:31:00 2023 Watch!

00:34:28 What We've Been Playing

00:47:30 GoldenEye 007 Turns 25

00:54:25 Video Game 20 Questions

item.title: Game Scoop! 683: Daemon's Favorite Stuff of 2022 So Far
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Sam Claiborn, Justin Davis, and Nicholas Limon -- are discussing their favorite games, movies, and TV shows of the year so far. That means Elden Ring, Tunic, Better Call Saul, TMNT Shredder's Revenge, Triangle Strategy, and so much more. They also flip through the July 2011 issue of the Official PlayStation Magazine. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

item.title: Game Scoop! 682: Game of the Year Watch Continues
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Justin Davis, Mark Medina, and Colin Stevens -- are continuing the Game of the Year Watch discussion. That means Elden Ring, Tunic, Horizon Forbidden West, and a look ahead at God of War Ragnarok. There's also that Lollipop Chainsaw remake to discuss and Forspoken's delay. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.
item.author: dan_parkhurst@ign.com (IGN)

This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Justin Davis, Mark Medina, and Colin Stevens -- are continuing the Game of the Year Watch discussion. That means Elden Ring, Tunic, Horizon Forbidden West, and a look ahead at God of War Ragnarok. There's also that Lollipop Chainsaw remake to discuss and Forspoken's delay. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

The music this episode is from Ghouls 'n Ghosts, Giga Wing, and Gain Ground.

item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, Kat Bailey, and Colin Stevens -- are discussing Sony's second State of Play of the year covering a first look at Harry Potter Hogwarts Legacy's, new information on Starfield revealed by Bethesda, Dead Space's audio plus-ups, and how to go about playing the Pokémon series for the first time and where to start. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

item.title: Game Scoop! 667: The Most Unforgivable Game Design Choices
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, Justin Davis, and Michael Swaim -- are discussing Sony's first State of Play of the year, a rundown on exciting releases in March, unforgivable design choices from the personal POV of our panel, and some of our picks for what the most influential games with lasting game design impact. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

This week your Omega Cops -- Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, Justin Davis, and Michael Swaim -- are discussing Sony's first State of Play of the year, a rundown on exciting releases in March, unforgivable design choices from the personal POV of our panel, and some of our picks for what the most influential games with lasting game design impact. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

item.title: This Changes Everything
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are discussing what will likely end up being the biggest story of the year: Microsoft acquiring Activision Blizzard. They also look at the best-selling games of 2021. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions.

item.title: PlayStation, Xbox or Nintendo -- Who Had the Best Year?
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop! (and Unlocked and Beyond and NVC), IGN's podcast series! This week Daemon Hatfield is joined by Ryan McCaffrey, Jonathon Dornbush, and Seth Macy to discuss Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo, and everything that went down in 2021. Forza Horizon 5, Halo Infinite, Deathloop, Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, Returnal, Metroid Dread -- all will be discussed!

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 643
item.description: On this episode of Game Scoop! we discuss our impressions of Arkane's Deathloop and go over the week's hardware update news around the Nintendo Switch and the PS5. We also muse over a hypothetical world in which one console could rule them all, and brainstorm ideas around what game developers we think could take on games around various Pixar or Disney properties. Plus video game 20 questions! Scoop!

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 642
item.description: On this episode of Game Scoop! we discuss some of the biggest announcements and surprises from Sony's Playstation Showcase. We also take a stroll down memory lane with some viewer questions about our favorite years in gaming and a few split-screen titles that really made an impact on us. Plus video game 20 questions! Scoop!

item.title: Game Scoop! 641: Tech Demos Are Cool
item.description: On this episode of Game Scoop! the Omega Cops chat Welcome to Raccoon City, Game Informer’s enlightening interview about crunch at Naughty Dog, that REALLY COOL Dead Space Remake Tech demo that has us all saying “nicely job”, and the latest gameplay showing from the Marvel/2K game that everyone is talking about, Midnight Suns.  Plus video game 20 questions if we get around to it.  Scoop!

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 633
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Justin Davis, and Seth Macy -- are discussing the next Assassin's Creed, Nintendo Switch OLED model, Deathloop, Death Stranding, and more. And, of course, they play Video Game 20 Questions. The music in this episode is from Super Star Soldier on TurboGrafx-16 and the outro song is Daemon's cover of "Destination Venus."

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 632
item.description: Welcome back to IGN Game Scoop!, the ONLY video game podcast! This week your Omega Cops are helmed by guest host Tina Amini, who is joined by Kat Bailey, Samuel Claiborn, and Justin Davis to discuss Sony's purchase of Returnal developer Housemarue, Remedy's announcement of a Control multiplayer spinoff, what Bloober and Konami's partnership announced this week means for a potential for a Silent Hills return, and more... And as always, we play a rollicking round of Video Game 20 Questions!

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 613
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are talking about Ubisoft's plan to rely less on AAA games and more on free-to-play and "games as a service." There's also a release date for Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart, the bizarre return of Six Days in Fallujah, completely random new additions to the Nintendo Switch Online service, and more.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 611
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game talk show. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are talking Hitman III and the very Daemie game Cyber Shadow. There's also strange news on the next Tomb Raider game and Daemon has a few theories about Godzilla vs. Kong. The opening jingle is from Gain Ground on the Sega Genesis.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 609
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are discussing all the Lucasfilm Games news from this week: Ubisoft's Star Wars and Bethesda's Indiana Jones. Oh yeah, they also have a Super Mario 3D World reaction and Video Game 20 Questions, too. This episode features music from Metroid, Super Metroid, and Streets of Rage.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 608
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. In the first episode of 2021, your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are talking more Cyberpunk now that we've beat it (no spoilers), games that are stuck in development hell (looking at you, Dead Island 2), playing Video Game 20 Questions, and more. The music in this episode is from Mega Man 5, and the outro song is by Daemon and is called "Turbo Mode."

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 607
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. It's the last episode of 2020, and that means it's time for The Daemie Awards! Your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- also discuss Perfect Dark, the most popular games of 2020 on IGN, and the 2021 games they're looking forward to. Thanks for sticking with us through this insane year, and happy holidays! We'll be back the first week of January.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 606
item.description:
Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. Our Game of the Year Nominees have been announced, so it's time for your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- to discuss:

- Animal Crossing

- Assassin's Creed Valhalla

- Cyberpunk

- Final Fantasy 7 Remake

- Ghost of Tsushima

- Hades

- Half-Life Alyx

- The Last of Us Part 2

- Spider-Man Miles Morales

- Microsoft Flight Simulator

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 605
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Justin Davis, Mark Medina, and maybe a special guest -- are discussing the WORST games of the year. Oh yeah, there's also this game called Cyberpunk to talk about. The song at the end of this episode is the acoustic version of Daemon's Christmas song, "1985."

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 604
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Co-op Mages -- Daemon Hatfield, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are wondering if Marvel's Avengers will ever make its money back. They'll also discuss Assassin's Creed Valhalla, the best time to launch a console, and flip through the December 1988 issue of Video Games & Computer Entertainment. The music this episode is from Blades of Steel. Scoop!

item.title: Game Scoop Presents: The 100 Questions Challenge (2020 Ed.)
item.description: It's that time of year again -- time for a FEAST of 20 questions challenges. Everyone knows that each episode of Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast, ends with a round of Video Game 20 Questions. And once a year, around a certain gluttonous holiday, we send the Omega Cops through a gauntlet of 100 Questions to see how many games they can guess. Play along at home!

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 603
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are sharing stories of their first week with PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X. Astro's Playroom, Miles Morales, Demon's Souls, Assassin's Creed Valhalla, and so much more.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 602
item.description: A new console generation is born! This week the Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Mark Medina -- are sharing their thoughts on Xbox Series X, PlayStation 5, Assassin's Creed Valhalla, and more. The outdo song is called "Like a Star" off Daemon's Black Cloud album.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 601
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game talk show. It's the last episode of this console generation! This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are discussing the contenders for Game of the Generation. Breath of the Wild, Red Dead Redemption II, God of War, Overwatch, and so much more. They also have thoughts on Watch Dogs Legion, Spider-Man Miles Morales, Pikmin 3, and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity. The music in this episode is from the original Metal Gear and the outro song is called "Palestine Hotel" off Daemon's Black Cloud album.

item.title: Game Spook 600: Our Favorite Horror Games from Each Generation
item.description:
What an episode! Not only is it our yearly Halloween-themed Game Spook! episode, it's also our 600th edition of this humble little podcast. Thank you so much to everyone who listens every week!

 

On the docket for this episode: Our favorite horror games from every generation, Control comes to Switch, Watch Dogs Legion, and so much more. The music this episode is from Castlevania Bloodlines and the outro track is called "Beware the Daemon."
item.author: dan_parkhurst@ign.com (IGN)

item.title: Game Scoop Advance
item.description: This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- are discussing the major advancements of this console generation, a "new" Fire Emblem, British retro gaming, and more. This episode features music from Castlevania IV, and the outro track is called "The Returned."

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 599
item.description: Game of the Year Watch continues with The Last of Us Part 2, Hades, Ghost of Tsushima, Animal Crossing, and more. Your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- also discuss the PlayStation 5 UI, the Xbox Series X launch lineup, and D-pads. This episode features music from Werewolf and Blaster Master on NES. The final track is Daemon's song "Control You."

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 598
item.description: Welcome back to Game Scoop!, IGN's weekly video game podcast. This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Sam Claiborn, Justin Davis, and Seth Macy -- are discussing the future of Nintendo consoles. They also cover Super Mario 35, Star Wars Squadrons, The Last of Us Part 2, Rambo in Mortal Kombat, and so much more.

item.title: Game Scoop Episode 597
item.description: This week your Omega Cops -- Daemon Hatfield, Tina Amini, Sam Claiborn, and Justin Davis -- discuss the disappointment around Spider-Man Ultimate Edition on PS5, they play "Real Mature, Video Games," discuss Star Wars Squadrons, flip through the October 1994 issue of Electronic Games, and more. The music in this episode is from Alien 3 on NES and the closing track is Daemon's new cover of "Pet Sematary" by the Ramones. Scoop!

The music in this episode is from Alien 3 on NES and the closing track is Daemon's new cover of "Pet Sematary" by the Ramones. Scoop!
